title: Pedophile who repeatedly raped girl, 10, is freed from prison by mistake
text:
Tony Maycon Munoz-Mendez, 31, was released ‘in error’ from Rogers State Prison in Reidsville, on October 25 (Pictures: Rogers State Prison/Google Maps)

A notorious pedophile who repeatedly raped his girlfriend’s 10 year-old daughter is on the run after being freed from jail by mistake.

Tony Maycon Munoz-Mendez, 31, was released ‘in error’ four years into a life sentence at Rogers State Prison in Reidsville, Georgia, on October 25, officials admitted.

They have refused to say how the blunder occurred, but insist ‘a full internal investigation’ is now ongoing.

Prosecutor John Warr, who helped put Munoz-Mendez away, said that neither he, the victim, nor the victim’s family had been warned that Munoz-Mendez was on the loose.

Warr vividly recalls the horrific court case, saying: ‘This one was particularly bad.’

Munoz-Mendez, pictured in 2013, was jailed for life in 2014 for repeatedly raping his girlfriend’s 10 year-old daughter

The pedophile had been living with his victim and her mother – his girlfriend – when he began molesting the child in 2010.

Munoz-Mendez then raped the youngster multiple times over a period of several years.

Shockingly, the youngster’s mother refused to believe the child’s claims, and instead took sides with her pedophile boyfriend.

Warr added: ‘Her mother failed to report that to the police, or take any measures to keep her daughter safe from this person in the home.’

He has called for a full review of security procedures that allowed Munoz-Mendez to talk out.

Munoz-Mendez’s accidental release was shared with the public Monday in a bid to track him down.

He was sentenced to life behind bars in April 2015, with a huge manhunt now launched to try and track him down.

A spokesman for the Georgia Department of Corrections told 11Alive: ‘All resources are being utilized to ensure the rapid apprehension of Munoz-Mendez, including the Georgia Department of Corrections Fugitive Unit and US Marshals..

‘The priority of the GDC is apprehending the offender as quickly as possible, and at this time, we have all resources focused on the search.

‘As soon as the error was discovered, the GDC immediately put those resources into place.’

The Georgia Department of Corrections has asked people to keep an eye out for Munoz-Mendez, and to call 911 if they believe they have spotted ihm.

He is described as being 5’9 tall and weighing around 186 pounds. He has brown hair and brown eyes.
